medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper abdominal and lower chest area pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 48 hours ago with nausea, vomiting, and RUQ abdominal pain. The patient has been feeling fatigued over the weekend but attributed it to hard work. The pain worsened over time, especially when breathing deeply, seated, or lying down on the right side. The patient reported non-bloody vomiting and soft light-colored stools, with no change in urine color.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1) Tinea Versicolor 2) Retinal Nevus - has not followed up for several years 3) Elevated Blood Pressure Without Diagnosis of Hypertension 4) Ruptured left Achilles tendon
medical_history.family_history: Father with myocardial infarction x2, diabetes mellitus, kidney disease, and colon cancer (diagnosed at age unspecified). Mother with hypertension. Brother with cholecystectomy x years ago. Paternal grandmother with diabetes mellitus and kidney disease. Paternal grandfather with emphysema. Maternal grandmother with heart issues; died of progressive Alzheimer's disease. Maternal aunt with non-smoker lung cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Works with assisted livings, difficult to trace sick contacts; history of fatigue attributed to hard work; not specified for smoking, alcohol, or drug use.
